body:
Looks like we should add `Actor.signal`

```
def signal(onSignal: PartialFunction[(ActorContext[T], Signal), Behavior[T]]): Behavior[T]
```

Contribution is welcome
OK, I'll give it a try ...
I haven't found any tests for the DSL in `akka.typed.scala/javadsl.Actor`.
tests are in the akka-typed-tests project, because of dependencies to testkit
I know, but there are no tests for the DSL. Or am I missing something?

ok, there is a mix of different styles there. Perhaps `DeferredSpec` is a good example. There you see both `StubbedTests` and `RealTests`. For this small feature you don't have to write both, pick one of them, your choice.
Hmm ... looking at the tests, I guess the new tests should be added to `BehaviorSpec`, right? But that class utterly confuses me.

that one is not easy to understand (I don't unless I read up on it)
you can create a new `SignalSpec` based on `DeferredSpec`

issue.title: Add signal method to Akka Typed DSL (closes #23640)

body: @patriknw do we really need all that ceremony? Ain't it enough to use `EffectfulActorContext` like in https://github.com/hseeberger/learning-akka-typed/blob/master/src/test/scala/de/heikoseeberger/learningakkatyped/SeqNoGeneratorSpec.scala#L23?
that would be fine if you can test watch+termination with EffectfulActorContext
OK, created a spec according to `DeferredSpec`.
